summary: This is an email chain between U.S. Attorney's Office (SDNY) personnel discussing the handling of factual comments on an OPR draft report related to the Epstein case. The emails focus on logistical coordination for providing feedback to the OIG.

persons.name: Associate U.S. Attorney
persons.context: The sender of the final email in the chain, providing contact information from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York.

events.title: Email Coordination on OPR Report Comments
events.description: SDNY personnel coordinate via email on how to submit factual comments regarding an OPR draft report on the Epstein case to the OIG.

events.title: OCR'd OPR Report Shared
events.description: An associate U.S. attorney creates and shares an OCR'd version of an OPR report, noting it contains several references to 'global' and is 121 megabytes in size.

locations.context: Address of the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York, provided in the email signature.

keyFacts: The document is an internal email chain from August 2020 among SDNY personnel regarding an OPR (Office of Professional Responsibility) draft report on the Epstein case.
The team had 'a couple of small factual comments' on the OPR draft report, but none were considered material to its conclusions.
An OCR (Optical Character Recognition) version of the report was created because the original was not word-searchable; it was 121 megabytes and contained several references to 'global'.
The correspondence shows ongoing administrative and review processes within the DOJ regarding internal investigations related to the Epstein case years after his death.
